sometimes  told  that  computers  couldn’t  simulate  feeling  depressed  or
falling in love or having a sense of humor. But as far as simulation is con-
cerned you can program your computer to print out “I am depressed,” “I love
Sally,” or “Ha, ha,” as easily as you can program it to print out “3 3 9.”
The real mistake is to suppose that simulation is duplication, and that
mistake  is  the  same  regardless  of  what  mental  states  we  are  talking
about.
